alert.note: Alert for Orange; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 2:58PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Orange and north central Osceola Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 256 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wedgefield, moving west at 15 mph. There is also a strong outflow boundary rapidly ahead of this thunderstorm. This outflow will reach areas from Orlando to Kissimmee and cause a noticeable increase in wind speeds. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Kissimmee, Wedgefield, Orlando International Airport and Avalon Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
